Seriously... Everything comes together in this beautifully crafted masterpiece; picturesque/art like graphics, captivating atmosphere and an emotional storyline with incredible twists, great music that fits the era, smooth controls and satisfying combat.

I have fallen in love with this game in the first 10 minutes. Yeah, it's that good.

I strongly recommend Bioshock Infinite and the two DLCs (Burial at Sea Ep1-2) they are equally amazing too, especially if you have played the first title in the franchise because they serve as a prequel to the original Bioshock game!

So do yourself a favor and try this game!

Note: I write this as someone who loves story-driven games, and couldn't care less about an FPS. I played through Bioshock series on easy difficulty, not caring a whit about the combat or combat mechanics. If you want those reviewed; look elsewhere.

For those new to the series, Bioshock Infinite requires no knowledge of the previous Bioshock games to complete.  There are some Easter Eggs, and one of the later sequences makes slightly more sense, if you've played the other games.  But Infinite is a stand-alone game, that chronologically takes place before Rapture (the Bioshock 1 and 2 setting) was built.

That being said, Infinite is clearly a Bioshock game.  It has the same strengths.  And unforunately, the same weaknesses.

First, the good parts.  The game is beautiful to look at, particularly the backgrounds and skylines.  I could listen to the game's music all day (the barbershop quartet at the beginning is particularly good).  Elizabeth--the sidekick and guide through most of the game--is great, and her banter with the main character adds an extra layer of depth to basically every part of the game.  The skyline system--essentially you get around, and often times even fight, but using a hook to latch onto an aerial railway--is clever and works extremely well.

All of those things make the game worth playing.  But be warned, not all is well:

- The villian is heavy handed, and clearly the worst Bioshock villian.  In the previous Bioshocks, there was a sense that the villians were fully aware of the fact that even though they had decided to do great evil in the name of (purpotedly) a greater good, those decisions still weighed on their consciousness.  In Infinite, the villian came across as too much of a zealot, and too many of his actions took so long to explain that for most of the game they felt simply like evil for the sake of evil.

- The game gets rid of meaningful player choice.  Choices matter less in Bioshock 2 than in 1; here there are no real meaningful choices at all, which is disapointing.

- The ending is confusing, ambiguous, and contradictory (possibly intentionally so).  I wish game designers would stop trying to be artsy with these things.  You aren't writing War and Peace here.  Take a stand.  Be clear.  Make your intentions known.  If you want a tragic ending, make it a tragic ending.  If you want a happy ending, make it a happy ending.  If you want a bittersweet ending, at least be clear about what happened.  Ambiguous endings leave sour last notes on great games, and Infinite is a great example.

- Once again, like Bioshock 2, the fates of several important side characters are left hanging.  Once they have served their purpose in the plot, they are simply discarded, never to be heard from again.

So if you liked the previous Bioshocks, you'll probably like Infinite.  If you enjoy story-driven games in interesting settings with beautiful scenery and gorgeous music, then you should definitely play infinite.  But if you like your story-driven games to have strong endings...  well, be warned, you won't find that here.

The gameplay aspect of the main game is a little bit dull because you can only carry two weapons and apparently each weapons have 2 variants that works different from the other one. The difficulty level is a bit weird. Easy and Normal feels like Easy while Hard feels like Normal. The 1999 mode is just the same with Hard with the exception that you lose more money on death.

Despite the lacking in gameplay, the game story itself is confusing yet wonderful at the same time.

As for the DLCs, Clash in the Clouds is a fun DLC for those who enjoy arena type of games. You can collect points that can be used to upgrade your character stats, weapons, vigors or you can use them to unlock stuffs in the museum.

The Burial at Sea DLC is a fun addition to the main story where you can play as 'Booker' in the first episode and Elizabeth in the second episode. Plenty of plot twists regarding about the main game and Bioshock. You can carry multiple weapons in this game which is pretty neat if you ask me. As for difficulty system is really great. Hard feels like how it should be, ammo is pretty scarce if you ask me, enemy deals more damage up to the point you going to die a lot like I did.

If you can bear the dull gameplay system for the sake of an interesting story that you might get a little bit frustrated but satisfied the moment you understand everything, then go ahead and buy this game.

[h1]바이오쇼크는, 바이오쇼크입니다.[/h1]

아름답고 밝은 배경, 경쾌한 BGM에 숨겨져있는 바이오쇼크의 이면이 정말 매력적인 게임이였습니다.
 
스토리는 후반으로 갈수록 미친듯이 복잡해지지만, 수 많은 진실과 반전에 아득해집니다. 너무 복잡해서 스토리를 다 파악하지는 못했지만, 1회차로 느낀 스토리의 치밀함에 느낀 감동(혹은 쇼크)는 바이오쇼크1 못지 않았습니다. 그래픽도 상당히 수준급으로, 제 컴퓨터에서도 60FPS로 미려한 화면을 보여줬습니다.

다만 조금 불편한 시스템과, 그 중 제가 가장 큰 단점으로 느낀 저장시스템. 퀵세이브가 없는대 자동저장 간격이 매우 길어서 상당히 불편했습니다. 나머지 불편한 점은 적은 탄약의 문제라던가 업그레이드를 위한 피나는 노력 등이랄까요.

그렇다 할지라도 스토리를 중시하는 제 입장에서 상당히 매력적인 게임이였습니다. 랩쳐를 다시 한번 보고싶군요.

Потрясающий сюжет. Великолепное музыкальное сопровождение. Дизайн уровней, перед которым стоит снять шляпу (моё увожение). Динамичный геймплей. Прекрасная Элизабет.

Шедевральная мозговыносящая сюжетная линия, невероятная смесь теорий о параллельных вселенных, временных аномалиях и банальной, но суровой человеческой алчности.
Атмосферность. Привычная с предыдущих частей неприятная враждебная атмосфера, успешно компенсированная в этот раз наличием дружественной невинной со-героини.
Сказочный тревожный романтичный сон, стимпанк помноженный на фентези и делённый на научную фантастику. Суровая безысходность концовок, нивелируемая оптимизмом DLC, возвращающая потерянных полюбившихся героев для того чтобы сызнова ощутить их потерю.

Оригинал+DLC стоят того, чтобы пройти (DLC без прохождения оригинала (Infinite) будут не так атмосферны).

После полного прохождения данной игры,вместе с DLC начинаешь задумываться на сколько бывают гениальные люди,способные придумать такое.Честно говоря даже не знаю с чего начать, начну пожалуй с первого что бросается в глаза,а это конечно же графика,здесь она очень красиво сделана,картинка яркая и насыщенная.Сюжет превосходен,понять его сразу довольно сложно,и после первого прохождения вряд ли удастся,но поняв поражаешься его гениальности.Больше всего конечно понравилась Элизабет,для меня это вообще лучший женский персонаж в видеоиграх,её поведение и отличная озвучка заставляет забыть что это персонаж игры,просто полностью погружаешься в эту историю и переживаешь её.И конечно финал второго эпизода просто разрывающий,такого конца для неё точно не ожидаешь,это одновременно бесподобно и так грустно... Описать это не возможно.Так же в игре отличная музыка,а треки("Will The Circle Be Unbroken","You Belong To Me","La Vie en Rose" и "Garry Schyman – Elizabeth") самые запоминающиеся.
Оценку я не могу поставить,можно сказать что это не игра,а произведение искусства,а искусство невозможно оценить..

Probably one of the best FPS games I've ever played. Beautiful environments, fantastic music that is appropriate to the time and adds to the overall atmosphere, top-notch voice-acting, great gameplay and combat, interesting and captivating plot, multi-faceted and relatable characters that grow and change as the plot develops, smart AI in the form of Elizabeth, and awesome DLCs as well. I highly recommend this game for FPS gamers looking for a story-driven narrative that doesn't disappoint. I bought this game + season pass bundle when it was selling for around $15 and I must say, it's one of the best $15 I've spend on a game. I would say that it would be best to the get the Season Pass because the Burial At Sea DLCs wrap up the story up nicely and even connects the story of Bioshock Infinite with the first aBioshock. I can't say enough about how much I like this game and it does beyond the usage of words. This game lingered in my mind for quite some time even after I completed it.

All in all, a must buy. 10/10

This is not a game. This is an experience. A piece of art. The level of thought and care that the developers put in the world is mindblowing. The story is probably the best story you will ever see in a video game ever.Its complex, and its absolutely perfect. The level of imersion is also insane, columbia is absolutely stunning, and Booker & Elizabeth are both remarkable, mature , and well thought out characters. I am not going to go into gameplay on this review, but know that it sure isn't the best part of the game, but i doesn't get in the way of the storytelling, atleas it didn't in my experience. Bioshock Infinite Sets a new bar for shooters. It shows that shooters can have very good story, while being enjoyable at the same time. I can't express how much i like this game with words only. Its a thing you need to experience yourself.Please, do me a favor, and buy this game. Please. I promise that if you like good stories, you won't regret it.

This Bioshock game is really something, the story has really charming characters with an interesting lore that touches a broad list of themes: Religion, Fanaticism, Racism, Hunger, Social status, Parental issues, etc
The enviroments and stages are beautiful an impressive, steam-punk in all his glory.

If you like heavy story line games with a good gameplay and art, get this game, you won't get disappointed.

Gameplay-wise, there's some things that I don't like, but are minor issues:
Weapons are too common, we used to have some really cool steam-punk looking stuff, but in this game the weapon's models are just too bland (aside from like two weapons)

Few moral choices with heavy impact in the game, this is kind of disappointing
 
p.s.: I played almost 6 hours in a row to finish the game while I was traveling l0l (so, the game last about 10 hours, even more if you want all the achievements and stuff)
p.s.2: Elizabeth best gurl

В сюжете затронуты такие вопросы, которые, как мне кажется, задает себе каждый человек. Ну, по крайней мере, я задумывалась о таких вещах. Поиграйте, может быть и вы тоже.
Во-вторых, атмосфера игры. Потрясающие пейзажи: парящий в небесах город, так похожий на рай, нарисован теплых пастельных тонах. И то как меняются эти самые цвета по мере прохождения сюжета, который забрасывает нас в самые разные уголки. Соответствие картинки и звукового ряда так же не может не радовать. Музыка в игре просто замечательная. Очень хорошо проработана анимация персонажей. 
Геймплей лично мне показался удобным, интуитивным. Можно носить с собой только два вида оружия в оригинальной игре, а в дополнениях так и вообще в любой момент можно изменить выбор, доступны все. Это делает игру немного сложнее. Впрочем, Элизабет почти всю игру помогает доставать здоровье, боеприпасы, соли. Я бы рекомендовала выбирать сложность повыше, так даже интереснее.
Я думаю, многим понравится Элизабет. По мере прохождения сюжета она превращается из беззаботной девушки, которая танцует на пирсе, в грустную, местами жестокую главную героиню последнего дополнения. 
В общем, я рекомендую всем поиграть. Времени зря не потеряете, только приобретете новые впечатления и, возможно, новую любимую игру, как это вышло со мной.

BioShock Infinite brings entertainment to another level, I haven't had fun with a game for a long time. That doesn't mean all the others releases are bad but it's been a while since i had so much fun playing a game.

The plot it's one of the best i've seen in my entire gaming life, matching some Visual Novels and books i love (i kinda like a good plot and not the usual mindless action or generic shooting gallery we get most of the time). I don't think you'll find another game with a better quality plot anytime soon.

Graphics aren't realistic but that doesn't mean they are bad, they got kinda a unique style that makes everything beautiful. You could say they are the same as the older games but they certainly improved a lot. However i kinda get annoyed with the excessive "bloom" in some scenes, sometimes they are overused to the point of blinding you. Aside from that everything else is beautiful. 

There's the music, honestly it isn't great but it's not bad either, the combat music is the same for the whole game save some specific scenes and it gets repetitive after a while. It's average at best.

The gameplay is what you've already seen in BioShock 1 & 2 with some improvements. You can equip gears that gives you a few improvements like auto-casting lightning when you are struck or put your enemies on fire when you strike them with melee attacks.

There's the new "Sky-Line" mechanic that allows you to travel around the place and can even be used in your advantage during combat, your partner Elizabeth even rides with you.

And talking about Elizabeth, that's one hell of a companion. She is like Alyx in Half-Life 2: Episode One but instead of fighting she gives you support during and outside combat like finding and giving you ammo, salt, money and even warning about points of interest and some missable items like lockpicks. I love when i'm almost out of ammo and she throws me some ammo, she also plays a huge role in the plot.

Honestly i haven't cared about my companion in a single-player game since Alyx, she isn't useless like most companions who doesn't do jack aside from yelling at you all the time like 'AIM DOWN YOUR SIGHTS", " TAKE POINT", "THEY ARE KILLING US DO SOMETHING!!!". 

PC port is above average, there isn't much graphics options but at least the game runs great, without vsync the game always run above 60fps (sometimes going up to 90fps) with everything maxed out and the game has some pretty graphics.

It took me around 13 hours to beat the game.

My rate: 9,5

Als Erstes muss ich unbedingt etwas los werden:
Dieses Spiel ist der Oberhammer!
Nun zum Review: 
Man wird am Anfang einfachmal mit irgendwelchen wirren Theorien bebombt, und dann total unvorbereitet ins Spiel geschmissen. Das heisst zuerst eigentlich ausschliesslich in die Story, von der man erstmal gar nix versteht. Genau dann, wenn das Geplapper anfängt zu nerfen, heisst es: "Ballere dich durch alles durch, das dir im Weg stehen könnte." Eine tolle Ergänzung zum Shooter erweisen sich die Kräfte, die man im Spielverlauf freischaltet und aufleveln kann. 
Durch die überaus mitreissende Story, wird man in windeseile durch das Spiel gezogen. Immer, wenn der Shooterpart langfädig erscheint, oder anfängt eintönig zu werden, spinnt BioShock gekonnt eine Cutsequenz oder ein Dialog ein. 
Ich konnte gar nicht mehr aufhören und musste immerzu nachdenken, wie es weitergehen könnte. Die Geschichte hinter BioShock ist sehr tiefgründig und ermöglicht so manchen WTF-Moment und ziemlich viel Brainf*ck! Zudem gibt es immer wieder mal eine Schrecksekunde, durch gut getimte Animationen. 
Besonders hervorheben möchte ich noch die unglaublich schöne Landschaft von Columbia! Die schwebende Stadt ist wunderschön Animiert und bietet auch genügend Dialoge ausserhalb der Hauptstory, um sich stundenlang zu verlieren und allen zuzuhören. Das Comicdesign, das mich anfangs einwenig abschreckte, tat dem Spiel aber mehr als gut und ist meiner Meinung nach äusserst gelungen!
Da ich so ziemlich keine Kritikpunkte nennen kann und ich das Spiel verschlungen habe, gibt es von mir eine sonnenklare Kauffempfelung!

Firstly: This is the one and only game I've played for which I have felt compelled to write a review. 

It was truly a pleasure to play, with incredible scenery and gorgeous voice acting, but above all; Bioshock Infinite has, hands down, one of the best stories ever. Not just in games, either: For me it rivals some of the greatest pieces of literature ever published. Now I've been quite vague, so let me go into a bit more detail for the uninitiated out there.

Bioshock Infinite is a fps rpg with a firm focus on story. Once you get your finger around all the controls (it uses a good half of the keyboard) everything flows smoothly, and lets you enjoy the world (or as we find out - worlds, plural) around Booker Dewitt and Elizabeth. Combat mechanics work well, and there is some capacity for stealth. 

Ultimately, if you've ever enjoyed a good story with plenty of twists, or if you've ever enjoyed a fps, this is your jam. 

I will continue to recommend this game to everyone I meet for many years to come.

You may be looking into Bioshock Infinite because you liked Bioshock. That's understandable, Bioshock was a masterpeice, however Bio-Infinite is not quite like Bioshock. 

It's not BETTER, not WORSE, but very different... it is this difference that has allowed it to grow into something which is equally fantastic. You won't get quite the same experience, indeed the gunplay is vastly different for a variety of reasons. But if you are willing to except change then Bio-Infinite is a fun ride.

The gameplay is challenging... encounters with even minor enemies are deadly if you are not careful, and major ememies are a particular challenge. Yet no section is impossible if you know what you are doing and change up your tactics a wee bit. Victory is very satisfying because of this challenge. Bio-Infinite does not piss around.

The story can be hard to wrap your mind around, but I think it was pulled off quite well. Additionally, your "sidekick" (whom the story revolves around, and thus why I hesitate to call her a "sidekick") is one of the more believable and human-seeming characters in gaming. 

And besides looking good, the game runs amazingly. I only have the minimum requirements and I have no problems whatsoever running the game. Seriously, smooth as butter.

So, if you like well-crafted singleplayer experiences with good stories and gameplay, buy this and support games like this! Even if you don't, buy it anyway! It's a blast!
